Authors: Jun-Hong Dong, Xiao He, changlin zhao
Title:
Skvortzovia yunnanense sp. nov. a new species of
corticiaceous fungi from southern China
Keywords:
molecular phylogeny, taxonomy, wood-inhabiting fungi,
Yunnan province.
Abstract:
A new corticioid species, Skvortzovia yunnanense sp. nov.,
is described based on morphological and molecular characters.
Skvortzovia yunnanense is characterized by annual, resupinate, very thin
basidiomata with smooth, white to pale cream hymenial surface and a
monomitic hyphal system with clamped generative hyphae and allantoid,
colorless, thin-walled, smooth basidiospores (5  6.5 ´ 1  1.5 µm) and
presence of larger halocystidia. Sequences of ITS and nLSU nrRNA gene
regions of the studied samples were generated, and phylogenetic analyses
were performed with maximum likelihood, maximum parsimony and bayesian
inference methods. The phylogenetic analyses based on molecular data of
ITS and ITS+nLSU sequences showed that S. yunnanense formed a single
lineage with a well support (100% BS, 100% BP and 1.00 BPP), and then
grouped with S. furfurella and S. meridionalis.
